nodes.bodyText: I am not sure whether RelOptUtil is the best place to hold these methods. Any suggestion is appreciated.
I think the part of construct pairs of traits for passThroughTraits and dervieTratis are better kept in Enumerable nodes, at least for better readability.

I think I made a mistake on such tests. To improve readability, it's better to do
select cast(deptno as float) from sales.emp order by  deptno desc.
But these two queries are testing the same thing.
Makes sense.

Depends on if we want move all most all the code to RelOptUtil, I feel like only isCollationOnTrivialExpr can be moved to RelOptUtil.
At least RelOptUtil.passThroughTraits and RelOptTuil. deriveTraits, seems to me, could encourage people write all passThroughTraits and deriveTraits into RelOptUtil, because names here are too generic.
For example, I might ask, why not move implementations in Enumerable Joins to RelOptUtil, etc. And will they become a part of RelOptUtil.passThroughTraits and RelOptTuil. deriveTraits?

I had the same feeling. How about add a package level internal interface for EnumerableProject and EnumerableCalc with default implementation so that both operators just need to implement the interface?
@hsyuan Instead of adding an interface, how about adding an EnumTraitUtils to hold these methods?  IMO, an interface seems not necessary since only Calc and Project should implement it.
@amaliujia We could change the name to clarify what it is doing.

Sure. Either have a EnumTraitUtils (to host as much code to share for traits propagation) or rename it is fine.
I find there is another case to share trait propagation code: https://jira.apache.org/jira/browse/CALCITE-4057. So after this PR to build a code sharing place, we can also apply it to  CALCITE-4057.
Sounds fare. Be sure to make it package level class, and mark it for internal use.
